channel.title: PLEASE NEED Help with model viewer
channel.description:
okay im confused im trying to make new items and i got the model viewer and i compiled and ran it and its attempting to grab something but it keeps saying this or w/e
[code] C:\Documents and Settings\Compaq_Owner\Desktop\RSMV>java Main Runescape Model Grabber Thanks to Silabsoft ~~~~~~~~~~ Grabbing Cache Version. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480 Rejected. Trying: 480[/code]
why is it saying rejected and how can i make it grab the models in my client?

item.title: PLEASE NEED Help with model viewer
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“Iceman”]Step 1:Go into the item dump and find the item you want to recolor
Step 2:Open up your Class8.java (in the client) and find a previous recolored item like lava boots.

Look at this for a second:

if(i == 15341){
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073;
class8.anInt174 = 5037;
class8.anInt181 = 770;
class8.anInt190 = 164;
class8.anInt198 = 156;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 3;
class8.anInt194 = -3;
class8.anInt165 = 4954;
class8.anInt200 = 5031;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
class8.aString170 = “Lava Boots”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “Lava boots”.getBytes();
}

Where it says:
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073;

class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61; Is the original item color and

class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073; is the new color (my lava color)

It always starts at 0, so if the item you want to recolor has more than one color,
you would do something like this:

class8.anIntArray156[1] = 6073;
class8.anIntArray160[1] = 6073;

Or if there were 3 colors you would do

class8.anIntArray156[2] = 6073;
class8.anIntArray160[2] = 6073;

Because it starts at 0.

Here an example of rune boots in the item dump:

Item Name: Rune boots
Item ID: 4131
Original model colors: 61
Changed model colors: 36133
anInt174: 5037
anInt181: 770
anInt190: 164
anInt198: 156
anInt204: 0
anInt169: 3
anInt194: -3
anInt165: 4954
anInt200: 5031
anInt188: -1
anInt164: -1
anInt175: -1
anInt197: -1

Where it says orginial thats the number you put in this

class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61;

The modified color or my lava color is

class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073;

Also you need to add these as well:
anInt174: 5037
anInt181: 770
anInt190: 164
anInt198: 156
anInt204: 0
anInt169: 3
anInt194: -3
anInt165: 4954
anInt200: 5031
anInt188: -1
anInt164: -1
anInt175: -1
anInt197: -1

NOTE: ^^^^ the anInts are different on every item

and make sure in your Class8.java its in this format

if(i == 15341){
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073;
class8.anInt174 = 5037;
class8.anInt181 = 770;
class8.anInt190 = 164;
class8.anInt198 = 156;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 3;
class8.anInt194 = -3;
class8.anInt165 = 4954;
class8.anInt200 = 5031;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
class8.aString170 = “Lava Boots”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “Lava boots”.getBytes();
}

ENJOY RECOLORING YOUR ITEMS!!!

-Iceman[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: PLEASE NEED Help with model viewer
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

lol, the problem is that you can’t receive 480 models anymore as runescape is now on their 509 cache. Lol. So you try to recieve 480 files which they don’t have anymore and it can’t do it. So go to rune~server, go to the models section and download the upgraded model viewer by clienthax.

Read full topic
